crops.name: blue jazz

info.description: The flower grows in a sphere to invite as many butterflies as possible.

notes: If placed within proper range of a Bee House (5 squares horizontally, 4 squares vertically), a Blue Jazz will cause the Honey produced to become more profitable.
Fully grown Blue Jazz flowers have an equal chance of being one of six different colors.
Blue Jazz flowers of different colors will occupy different slots in inventory or chests. Six colors Ã— three quality levels = 18 possible spaces used.

crops.name: cauliflower

info.description: Valuable, but slow-growing. Despite its pale color, the florets are packed with nutrients.

notes: Has a chance to grow into a giant crop

crops.name: coffee bean

info.description: Plant in spring or summer to grow a coffee plant. Place five beans in a keg to make coffee.

notes: Has a 1% chance to drop from dust sprite

crops.name: garlic

info.description: Adds a wonderful zestiness to dishes. High quality garlic can be pretty spicy.

notes: Only available starting in year 2

info.description: A juicy little bean with a cool, crisp snap.

crops.name: kale

info.description: The waxy leaves are great in soups and stir fries.

notes: A scythe is required to harvest Kale.

info.description: A spring tuber closely related to the carrot. It has an earthy taste and is full of nutrients.

crops.name: potato

info.description: A widely cultivated tuber.

notes: Chance to spawn extra potatoes at harvest

info.description: The stalks are extremely tart, but make a great dessert when sweetened.

crops.name: strawberry

info.description: A sweet, juicy favorite with an appealing red color.

notes: Has a small chance for multiple fruit from each harvest

info.description: A sweet, juicy favorite with an appealing red color.

crops.name: blueberry

info.description: A popular berry reported to have many health benefits. The blue skin has the highest nutrient concentration.

notes: Has a small chance for multiple fruit from each harvest

info.description: One of the most popular grains. The sweet, fresh cobs are a summer favorite.

crops.name: hops

info.description: A bitter, tangy flower used to flavor beer.

notes: Hops can be put into a Keg to make Pale Ale. Pale Ale has one of the highest returns on investment in the game, surpassed only by Starfruit wine.

crops.name: hot pepper

info.description: Fiery hot with a hint of sweetness.

notes: Has a small chance for multiple fruit from each harvest

crops.name: melon

info.description: A cool, sweet summer treat.

notes: Has a chance to grow into a giant crop

info.description: In addition to its colorful flower, the Poppy has culinary and medicinal uses.
A crisp and refreshing root vegetable with hints of pepper when eaten raw.

crops.name: red cabbage

info.description: Often used in salads and coleslaws. The color can range from purple to blue to green-yellow depending on soil conditions.

notes: Only available starting in year 2

crops.name: starfruit

info.description: An extremely juicy fruit that grows in hot, humid weather. Slightly sweet with a sour undertone.

notes: Starfruit produces Artisan Goods that have some of the highest sell values in the game.
Starfruit is required to build a Junimo Hut, purchased from the Wizard's Tower.

info.description: A tropical bloom that thrives in the humid summer air. Has a sweet, tangy aroma.

crops.name: sunflower

info.description: A common misconception is that the flower turns so it's always facing the sun.

notes: Harvesting a sunflower will also produce 0-3 Sunflower Seeds

crops.name: tomato

info.description: Rich and slightly tangy, the Tomato has a wide variety of culinary uses.

notes: Has a small chance for multiple fruit from each harvest

crops.name: wheat

info.description: One of the most widely cultivated grains. Makes a great flour for breads and cakes.

notes: Wheat may be placed in a Keg to produce Beer.

crops.name: amaranth

info.description: A purple grain cultivated by an ancient civilization.

notes: A scythe is required to harvest Amaranth.

crops.name: artichoke

info.description: The bud of a thistle plant. The spiny outer leaves conceal a fleshy, filling interior.

notes: Only available starting in year 2

info.description: A sweet and earthy root vegetable. As a bonus, the leaves make a great salad.
The leafy greens and fibrous stalks are healthy and delicious.

crops.name: cranberries

info.description: These tart red berries are a traditional winter food.

notes: Harvest gives two Cranberries and has a small chance to provide more

crops.name: eggplant

info.description: A rich and wholesome relative of the tomato. Delicious fried or stewed.

notes: Has a small chance for multiple vegetables from each harvest

crops.name: fairy rose

info.description: An old folk legend suggests that the sweet smell of this flower attracts fairies.

notes: The honey made from the flowers represents the most profitable honey possible.

info.description: A sweet cluster of fruit.

crops.name: pumpkin

info.description: A fall favorite, grown for its crunchy seeds and delicately flavored flesh. As a bonus, the hollow shell can be carved into a festive decoration.

notes: After Starfruit it has the second-highest per unit base price of all the normal crops.
Has a chance to grow into a giant crop

crops.name: yam

info.description: A starchy tuber with a lot of culinary versatility.

notes: Has a 3% chance of dropping from Duggies.
